data.Sentence_cn: 十三等于一
data.Sentence: --- lesson 2  Thirteen equals one

data.Sentence_cn: 我们教区的牧师总是为各种各样的事筹集资金，
data.Sentence: Our vicar is always raising money for one cause or another,

data.Sentence_cn: 但始终未能筹足资金把教堂的钟修好。
data.Sentence: but he has never managed to get enough money to have the church clock repaired.

data.Sentence_cn: 教堂的钟很大，以前不分昼夜打点报时，但在很多年前遭到毁坏，从此便无声无息了。
data.Sentence: The big clock which used to strike the hours day and night was damaged many years ago and has been silent ever since.

data.Sentence_cn: 一天夜里，我们的牧师突然被惊醒了，大钟又在“打点”报时了！
data.Sentence: One night, however, our vicar woke up with a start: the clock was striking the hours!

data.Sentence_cn: 他一看表，才1点钟，可是那钟一边敲了13下才停。
data.Sentence: Looking at his watch, he saw that it was one o'clock, but the bell struck thirteen times before it stopped.

data.Sentence_cn: 牧师拿着一支电筒走上钟楼想去看看究竟发生了什么事情。
data.Sentence: Armed with a torch, the vicar went up into the clock tower to see what was going on.

data.Sentence_cn: 借着电筒光。他看见一个人，马上认出那是本地杂货店店主比尔.威尔金斯。
data.Sentence: In the torchlight, he caught sight of a figure whom he immediately recognized as Bill Wilkins, our local grocer.

data.Sentence_cn: “你究竟在这上面干什么，比尔?”牧师惊讶地问。
data.Sentence: 'Whatever are you doing up here Bill?' asked the vicar in surprise.

data.Sentence_cn: “我想把这口钟修好，”比尔回答说。
data.Sentence: 'I'm trying to repair the bell,' answered Bill.

data.Sentence_cn: “好几个星期了，我天天夜里到钟楼上来。
data.Sentence: 'I've been coming up here night after night for weeks now.

data.Sentence_cn: 嗯，我是想让你大吃一惊。”
data.Sentence: You see, I was hoping to give you a surprise.'

data.Sentence_cn: “你确实使我大吃了一惊！”牧师说，
data.Sentence: 'You certainly did give me a surprise!' said the vicar.

data.Sentence_cn: “也许同时你把村里所有的人都吵醒了。
data.Sentence: 'You've probably woken up everyone in the village as well.

data.Sentence_cn: 不过，钟又能报时了，我还是很高兴的。”
data.Sentence: Still, I'm glad the bell is working again.'

data.Sentence_cn: “问题就在这里，牧师，”比尔回答说。
data.Sentence: 'That's the trouble, vicar,' answered Bill.

data.Sentence_cn: “不错，钟能报时了，但是，恐怕每到1点钟，它总要敲13下，对此我已无能为力了。”
data.Sentence: 'It's working all right, but I'm afraid that at one o'clock it will strike thirteen times and there's nothing I can do about it.'

data.Sentence_cn: “大家慢慢就习惯了，比尔，”牧师说。
data.Sentence: 'We'll get used to that, Bill,' said the vicar.

data.Sentence_cn: “13下是不如1下好，但总比1下也不敲强。
data.Sentence: 'Thirteen is not as good as one, but it's better than nothing.

data.Sentence_cn: 来，咱们下楼去喝杯茶吧。”
data.Sentence: Now let's go downstairs and have a cup of tea.'
